title: Teacher Interview

Interview Descriptions: A very useful and good for your experience.. Take the chance to follow your dreams and do your best to reach your goal.. Don't ever turn off your life for any refusal

title: Assistant Director, Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: I’m a currently a Financial Analyst at BU and applied for an Assistant Director of Finance position at another school within BU because I was looking to advance in my career. The recruiter and I spoke about how the new position would require increased responsibility, however the salary was the same as my current position. The BU recruiter asked if I would consider a lateral move in terms of salary. I understand they were looking out for their own interests, but I hope the recruiter understands how damaging it is to encourage a woman to take a promotion without a salary raise. I declined to continue with my application, which the recruiter called “unfortunate.” I hope BU can get to a place where they can match salaries to the market.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current position

title: Web Developer Interview

title: Assistant Professor Interview

title: Sr. Associate Director Interview

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

She was very rude when asked about my salary requirements and I did not want to give her a specific number. Even mumbling under breath. BU is not as great as people think it is.

I don't know how they expect people to stay happy and create a positive growth culture when you don't even get a response after an interview.

title: Graduate Student Interview

title: IT Communication/Documentation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: I applied and interviewed with BU for the IT Communication Specialist over the span of 6+ months. I applied in February 2022 and only got invited to interview in May. From May to August, there were several rounds of video interviews. Much time passed in between interviews with silence from the Hiring Manager. By August, I had finally got an update as to the status of hiring for the role. The hiring manager informed me that the team liked me-- but they couldn't offer me the job since I didn't have 5-7 years of work experience yet. This begs the question-- what was the point of putting me through rounds of interviews in the first place if they could never offer me the job? My time and energy was wasted interviewing here.
Interview Questions: What's your experience with Adobe products?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University

They seems very interested until we discussed salary and I suppose I didn't keep the surprise off my face at the $40k salary with no room for negotiation.

introduce self
5-6 skill based questions

title: Communication and Outreach Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was such a weird interview process. I applied for this role months ago. So long ago, in fact, that I had forgotten that I had even applied for it! I received an email from the HM of the role telling me she wanted to set up a Zoom interview for the next week. Cool. During the interview, however, things took a turn for the...weird. My interviewers were more interested in talking to each other than talking to me. They gave me the standard, boring, garden-variety questions, and I asked a few of my own. They then asked me when I'd be available to start. I told them that I lived in another state, so that would have to be factored into when I would start. Both of my interviewers paused and said to me that Boston University doesn't offer relocation packages, so I'd have to move there on my own dime. This information would have been great to know from the get-go as opposed to me hearing it from my interviewers. Overall, I felt like my interviewers and the HM weren't on the same page (or even in the ballpark of being on the same page), and it ultimately felt like a waste of time for me as the candidate.
Interview Questions: How do you work with competing deadlines?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview

title: Instructional Production Coordinator Interview

Then, I was pretty much lead on after the interview with "we'll follow up with you after x amount of time"-- being told this a couple times.

In the end, I received an automated rejection email. As being one that has interviewed at other institutions, I found the leading on and lack of communication to be very unprofessional on their part. It seems to me like their hiring process is mismanaged either by their department or university.

title: Assitant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: An interview is a structured conversation where one participant asks questions, and the other provides answers.[1] In common parlance, the word "interview" refers to a one-on-one conversation between an interviewer and an interviewee. The interviewer asks questions to which the interviewee responds, usually providing information. That information may be used or provided to other audiences immediately or later. This feature is common to many types of interviews – a job interview or interview with a witness to an event may have no other audience present at the time, but the answers will be later provided to others in the employment or investigative process. An interview may also transfer information in both directions.

title: Senior Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were several interviews including individual interview, panel interview and HR interview. The process look a bit longer than expected. The interview process was friendly and the university seems to have a good working culture.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job? Gave scenarios and ask how I would manage completing the tasks.

title: QA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Great experience, love my boss, great job too. Highly recommend. Dress formally and be yourself. It will work out because the hiring process is an opportunity to get to know the real you, not the embellished resume.
Interview Questions: Analyze a pen

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Few Conditions in order to qualify for this position: 

1. A top student in class- A grade
2. Excel in skills 
3. Excel in projects and assignments
4. A good relationship with classmates
5. A good relationship with the professor
6.  Willingness to learn, grade and teach in class
Interview Questions: Previous teaching experience if any?

title: Data Reaerch Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I like this position, the people here are really nice. During and after a candidate interview, take notes to gather your initial thoughts about them and their ability to contribute to the company.
Interview Questions: Tell me a bit about yourself

title: Manager of Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Three step interview process. Thirty minute phone screening followed by three hour in-person interview. During the in-person portion, I was interviewed by two different teams, as well as someone from human resources.  The third round involved a presentation in front of the staff team.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you found out a student left an internship/hasn't been showing up to their internship and has not communicated this to anyone?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions:
The Program Manager went over the job description, went over my experiences, and ended up talking in length about the research and day-to-day expectations. The experiences that were underlined were people skills, population engagement, foreign language abilities. I was asked lab skills and openness to working with invasive biospecimen collection methods, handling fluids, etc. 
The PM did not use behavioral interview questions.
Interview Questions: What other languages do you speak?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: 1 stage interview with the manager a one to one interview. The manager asked me about my experience and why I wanna work with them. They asked me have I used mail-merge before and I haven't, but once I get hired, they trained me how to do mail-merge. Everyone is really friendly at the office and they're looking for someone who's willing to learn
Interview Questions: Have you had any experience in administrative position?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with two PIs that I indicated interest to work with. It was very relaxed and they also explained what they do in their labs, their working style and the type of student they are looking for to join their lab.
Interview Questions: Research experience

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was good. They asked about my background and what I have done so far in my current position. And some other general questions. The team who interviewed me was very professional and they knew that what they were looking for.
Interview Questions: Mainly on the instrument and type of research that I worked on.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Quick and to the point! Screening with HR then one in person interview.  I met with multiple people in the department at once. I don't think it last more than an hour. The HR screening was pretty basic and mainly made sure I was okay with salary range.
Interview Questions: If I was interested in learning institution specific software.

title: Managing Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant interview. We spoke at length about my work as a managing editor and about the department they represented. They described the changes they were undergoing in production and said they'd be in touch soon since the job would begin in two weeks.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with peer review?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an email to set up a phone interview with two Assistant Directors. It was mostly basic questions about previous experience and why I was interested. Seemed strange that I was being interviewed by people with the same job title I was applying for, but it went well. Next stage was in-person and had two parts: first, a 3-person panel of admissions staff where I was asked to give a 10-minute presentation on my alma mater, and second a one-on-one meeting with a senior staff member (scheduled together, took about 2 hours all together). I got an email about a week later to meet with HR, which was a ten-minute meeting offering me the position and outlining benefits.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time when you had to make an unpopular decision or deliver tough news

title: Statistical Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Referred by Career Office. Got an email for a phone interview - a very simple, relaxed screening interview. Was told about the role and team, and environment and asked about my background/experience.  Then was called for an onsite interview within 2 days. All happened within 1-2 weeks. There were no technical questions. Most questions were about my experience and the projects they are/will be working on.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: I met with the managers above me directly for an in person sit down interview, and the process took no more than a half hour. the managers were efficient but kind and i felt the importance of teamwork was crucial. time management could be a little better though.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself impacting the department?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: One phone screening interview, another on-site with members of the team where sometimes a presentation is needed and with questions at the end. After that there was an HR interview.
Interview Questions: How would you help faculty members meet deadlines to submit content?

title: Assistant Professor of Administrative Sciences Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: At first, interview went quite smoothly. I applied online and had two rounds of interviews on Skype with the faculty. They offered me a job verbally and told me that I would receive the written job offer by email. However, after waiting for a couple of weeks, I heard nothing. When I chased it up, I was told that they offered the job to someone else. I do not have any problem with my application being refused, but this was a very unprofessional behaviour from the department. They refused to give me details about what happened. They played games with me.
Interview Questions: It was mainly about teaching different subjects in Marketing Analytics and research experience. I was asked to prepare a presentation on a topic of my choice.

title: Assistant Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: phone screen, then full day of in-person interviews.  Typical questions.  Met with peer level, boss, and boss's colleagues (so one level above), and a few faculty who were on search committee.    In addition, had a lunch with a large group who included a mix of these people.  Did not get tour of campus, but felt the process was run very smoothly other than that.
Interview Questions: Walk us through your background.  Why us?  What would you bring?  How would you approach job?  What your strengths?  Weaknesses?  Tell us one thing about you that is NOT on your resume?

title: Program Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied the job in January 2019 and got an email for in-person interview in April. I was surprised that the first round was in-person. 
I talked to one faculty and one staff. We had a great conversation and the interview lasted for a hour and 10 mins. And the faculty gave me his business card which was a good sign. I was told that they would have the decision in a week. I was confident after the interview and looking forward to hearing from them again but I've never heard back from them. I emailed to the faculty, the staff and the HR.. NO REPLY. 
I don't like the way they treated me. As least they should send me back an email.
Interview Questions:
What's your strength?
Why are you interested in this position?

title: Events Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online . The process took 1 month. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in December 2019. The interview process started with a phone screen, then two rounds of on site interviews. Overall, it was a very laid back and pleasant experience.
Interview Questions:
Can you describe your past event planning experience?
What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was fine, but getting to that phase was difficult. BU is very referral based, so you really need to network and go on informational interviews to make sure your resume actually gets in front of the right person.
Interview Questions: Describe your plan for your first 30, 60, and 90 days.

title: Room Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was painless. The supervisor was very friendly and willing to give you time to think about your answer to questions. It was a great interview experience and I enjoyed working for Boston University's Events and Conferences department later that summer.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? What are your weaknesses?

title: MBA Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: One hour phone interview, mostly background on position.  Invited to campus for 2.5 hours of interviews and then gave 20 minute presentation on career topic.  It was a very positive experience and I liked everyone I spoke with.
Interview Questions: Asked to review a student's resume and then asked to give coaching advice.

title: Career Advising Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was in person with an Assistant Director at Northeastern's Assistantship Fair, then the final round interview was in person with the Director who is also the supervisor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.  What made you interested in career advising? What is one strength and one weakness you have?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Asked me 3 tech interview questions in C. Asked very basic job interview questions. The interviewer was very nice and professional, she made me feel very welcomed. I felt very comfortable at the office and she was very nice and patient when answering my questions. I was very happy with the experience. I got the offer, but politely declined. Very good experience!
Interview Questions: Asked about my experience with Python and C

title: Graduate Student In the Speech Language Pathology Master's Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, two person panel interview with two members of the graduate student committee for the SLP Program.  I interviewed in the Spring (Feb) of 2019.  Interview was 6 minutes long. All interviews were scheduled to be last 6 minutes.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do in your spare time?

title: Alumni Relations Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Interviewer described the history of BU during the call for 30 minutes. He didn’t ask me any questions, just if I had any questions I would like to ask him. It was clear that he was trying to fill a quota of candidates spoken to and that they likely had already chosen a candidate for this position.
Interview Questions: Interviewer did not ask me any questions

title: Cooker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Friendly interview, but they ask me real tough question. They ask me how to cook calamari but I never cooked a calamari in my life! Also they make me answer why I want job!? To make moolah that's why!
Interview Questions: If I can cook good

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Brookline, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and smooth.  Talked about what I liked and disliked.  How I saw myself in the future and  what I wanted to get out of this job.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for and what interest you?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process for me. I had three rounds of interviews. Got the offer a week after the third round with HR. The process took close to two months.
Interview Questions: What's your biggest weakness? What are your work values? How do you stay organized?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It is usually based on the professor, but if you show interest in their research or helping in their department it, it should be fine. I was just shown his project outlook and where I saw myself and explained to him my abilities and time schedule.
Interview Questions: The interviewer asked me questions about my grades and ability to handle a new project. There was a strong focus on gauging my passion to ward the project and the field of study.

title: Software Engineer(Internship) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Behavioural, helpful and great mentors! Talked about resume and past experience. Was very easy if there was no prior formal experience since I had projects to help show for my lack thereof. Show a keen interest by asking relevant questions in their day to day life.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to solve a diffcult problem?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to schedule the interview via Zoom. The interview was conducted by a panel of professors. Each asked their questions and I was able to ask questions.
Interview Questions: How do you see your scholarship fitting into the wider research focus here?

title: Commincations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a long interview process. There was a supplementary application to fill out, an exercise to fill out, a phone screening,  an in person interview, and a recommendations process. Overall, the questions were standard for a communications position.
Interview Questions: Can you walk us through your creative process?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a job online in November 2018. I got an email inviting me for a phone interview for this particular role with the hiring manager. We spoke for about 20 minutes about the role, the company, and I did plenty of research beforehand so I could ask pertinent questions. The hiring manager actually remarked on how impressed they were that I had done research and that most people didn't look at the School's website to educate themselves prior to interviewing. We had a pretty good rapport and  I felt that I was a strong candidate. I was told that I would be hearing from the talent acquisition team in terms of next steps. I sent a follow up email after our call to thank the hiring manager for their time. The interview experience was positive. However I never received any kind of follow up after the call from talent acquisition like the told me I would. I've received more considerate correspondence from jobs that I've applied for and didn't even get an interview for to let me know I was no longer in consideration or that the position had been filled. Very unprofessional and inconsiderate.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at BU?

title: Communications Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great interview, good questions, until they asked my salary expectations. Soon found out they don't like to pay employees what they're worth. What kind of an institution pays Communications Administrators $41k?? BU seriously needs to evaluate their pay grades -- it seems almost every job is Grade 73 or 74 -- whether you're an admin assistant or even Director. And the "mid-point" is apparently only there with very very special approval. Very disappointing, as BU seems to be a great place to work otherwise. To be clear, these grades are a joke compared to other institutions such as MIT, Harvard. BU H/R -- pay attention -- this is a job seeker's market!
Interview Questions: Do you like working in a very busy environment?

title: Full Stack Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Video interview first. Interviewer introduced themselves and on-going projects. They want employees can adopt a fast-pace environment. What kind of programming languages do you use? The candidates have to work with various departments and employees. Also, they have multiple projects. The employee has to adopt that as well.   Second on-site interview with CS professors.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What is your status? where do you live? what is your expected salary?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was through and polite. The staff where fun to talk with and showed me around the space. I was able to share my experiences openly.  I met a majority of staff I would interact with there.  It was an honest review and I enjoyed the chance to be interviewed.
Interview Questions: What my needs where to advance my career.

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Quick turnaround from application to interview but slow to hear back about the hiring.  It was a one on one interview so it wasn't a challenge to engage with interviewer with responses and ask questions in turn.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing in 5 years

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and had a phone screen about 2 weeks later. In-person interview consisted of 3 meetings. The first meeting was with the Associate Dean and a few professors as well as a couple existing Sr Program Coordinators. The second interview was with an employee in the office and the third interview was with HR.
Interview Questions: As an employee, what can you contribute?

title: Marketing Communications Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straightforward and at each step of the process there was clear feedback about next steps. I was actively recruited so the process may have been faster than usual.
Interview Questions: HR asked me to describe a time I had overcome challenges or overcome a disagreement with a colleague about how to move forward with a project

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy but it took a while for them to actually get back to me. I just had to be patient and check back in often to finally get an answer from them.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The employer asked very general questions regarding my goals for the future, career possibilities after my work was completed, and what I would expect to learn from the job experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself after 5 years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for a research assistant was very little, all you have to do is show an interest in the topic of research and seem like a good student. It helps if you already have a relationship with the professor.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this lab?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. I almost felt too prepared but that is due to the nature of the job I applied for. HR was courteous and kind. Questions were straightforward and simple.
Interview Questions:
Why BU?
5 year goals?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I got referred to BU through an internship coordinator and my school and I came into the office and met with two members of the staff and they asked general internship questions
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Submit the application through the system, and waiting for the response. After the interview, you will get the result soon. It would be better if you could get a referral from your friend or classmates.
Interview Questions: Normal question

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Very brief. The recruitment phase of the hiring process takes place when the company tries to reach a pool of candidates through job postings, job referrals, advertisements, college campus recruitment, etc. Candidates who respond to these measures then come in for interviews and other methods of assessment. Employers may check the background of prospective employees, as well as check references.
Interview Questions: Educational background

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Contacted by HR for phone interview. No updates after that and followed up. Was told that they will call and be in contact in the following week but never heard anything back. Very poor communication of HR.
Interview Questions: Walk through resume.

title: Desktop Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Went through several situational and knowledge based questions to review your aptitude. They had a lot of questions that required you to role play and put yourself in the position of an IT professional
Interview Questions: How would you go about fixing this IT issue?

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Asked what qualities I possessed to fulfill the job. What I was looking to gain from the job. Met with head of department for half and hour and was given the job within a week later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to handle a difficult situation and how you solved it?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was informal.  I reached out to the professor, rather than university.  We had some preliminary phone calls and email exchanges.  I traveled to Boston to give a presentation and was given the position.  My travel was reimbursed.
Interview Questions: I was asked to give a one hour presentation to my prospective lab.  They asked me a number of follow-up questions about the talk, including discussions at the chalk board.

title: Writer/Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position at the Questrom School. It took quite a while to hear back in regards to getting an interview, but after a simple phone screen about my experience, I went for an in-person interview. I thought everything went well. I met the team, our personalities seemed to mesh, and I had planned to return the following week to meet with the director who was out of office. Never got a reply to any of my follow-up emails. It has now been two months, and in that time I’ve interviewed, accepted, and started another position. I found the whole experience positive, up until they simply stopped replying, and now I’m left questioning whether the “good vibes” I had were one-sided. I have a friend who is already employed at BU and she told me she is shocked by the unprofessionalism and lack of communication they exhibited.
Interview Questions: Basic, run of the mill- describe your experience, why BU, etc

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was contacted for an interview within a couple of weeks in person. Afterwards, met the team and went through a panel interview. I then went through HR for the background check and drug test, only after all that went through did I recieve a formal offer letter..
Interview Questions: What my biggest strength was

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have to apply online and can get a interview call within 2 weeks. They schedule an nterview which is quite informal. You can get the offer within the next week of the interview process
Interview Questions: Was just asked one question related to a software issue

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: casual, one on one.basic interests question and questions about managing time and work and academics and extra curricular activities. friendly staff and good interview process for student  role. basic interests question and questions about managing time and work and academics and extra curricular activities. friendly staff and good interview process for student  role
Interview Questions: basic interests question and questions about managing time and work and academics and extra curricular activities. friendly staff and good interview process for student  roles. basic interests question and questions about managing time and work and academics and extra curricular activities. friendly staff and good interview process for student  role

title: Desktop Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth, however panel interviews are conducted with 4 interviewers at a time- not a good way to get to know someone. Very intimidating. Went through the process, sent thank you emails after each interview. After the final interview, I heard nothing back. Completely unprofessional; sent a follow up email 4 weeks after final interview/thank you email - NOTHING. Completely left hanging. My advice: An institution where leadership does not respond to emails or provide constructive feedback - don't waste your time.
Interview Questions: Questions took a DEEP dive into what you do technically, not many questions were asked regarding my customer service skills.

title: Telefund Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I received the recruiting email and submit the application online. Then I got the chance for the interview. The interview was in a group setting and it was pretty casual: just raise your hand when you know the answer.
Interview Questions: what should you do when you are refused on the phone

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Just informal chat with one of the computer science professors there. Asked a little about past experience in the area that you're applying to and future plan such as whether you want to do an internship during the summer.
Interview Questions: Informal chat

title: Senior Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I got  a call from someone from talent management to set up a meeting. The interview process took two weeks and I met eight people - most on my team, 1 person from hr, 1 person from development talent management. Everyone was very nice.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and pleasant experience. Hiring manager was very professional. Received call from hiring manager as opposed to HR, went through three rounds of interviews. One interview was a panel of approximately six people, with whom the individual in the position would have regular contact. Questions were mostly about background experience and what I would bring to the position. Overall a great group of people.
Interview Questions: Mostly work experience and background

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for this position. About two-three weeks later, I received a phone screening.  After the phone screening, I had a panel interview and meet with some members of the team. I received an email with the offer about a week later.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple deadlines? What time of management do you work best with? How do you handle a mistake that you've made?

title: UROP Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief coding challenged followed by a 20-min video interview with the project lead where they went over my resume, I was informed of my UROP decision by the end of the day.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: IT Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: the interview was basically a behavioral one. I wasn't asked any technical question. Just questions about availability and experience and stuff. Don't worry just have a technical  background
Interview Questions: No technical questions

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, heard back a couple days later, and interviewed early the next week. The whole process was fast and efficient. I was very happy with the way they handled the situation.
Interview Questions: The biggest challenge you have to overcome

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: One behavioral interview with the program manager and reviewing of your caller stats. Your ability to manage stressful situations, oversee your peers, and maintain a positive and successful work environment are assessed.
Interview Questions: How you want to improve the office, how you problem solve, how you will manage working above your peers

title: Graduate Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The Graduate School of Arts and Sciences faculty were friendly and supportive to incoming grad students. I would say that this was less of an interview on their part, since I was already accepted into the program. Once I was in the program, interviews for positions such as TA, TF, and RF were informal and based on a number of internal factors.
Interview Questions: What are your research goals?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I met with my supervisor as well as someone who held a similar role to what I would be doing. The first interview was 30 minutes long. My second round interview was with the leadership team and lasted about an hour. I got a short tour and then left. My third interview was a meeting with HR to discuss their job offer.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time you had to support a student in crisis.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: [After reaching out to professor]Meet with professor one wants to do research under. He looks through your resume and sees if you are a good fit. After then you are asked some question about your knowledge and then you are shown the lab, etc.
Interview Questions: My level of knowledge of the research at hand.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview followed by an in person interview with several of the people I'd be working under. Very simple, basic conversation and assessment of skills. Not overly taxing.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. One in person interview. Got a call a few days later saying I got the position. Was able to start working the following week after filling out paperwork.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult person approaching the front desk?

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have to make a mock lesson plan and teach it. You will be asked questions on the lesson so be ready. Make sure the lesson plan is at least 15 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a peer tutor?

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: This was an internal hire, so the interview was very brief and informal.  It was more of a conversation about whether I would like to accept the position, and discussing logistics for how I'd function in the new role.
Interview Questions: Describe how I'd handle a difficult personnel problem.

title: Administrative Coordinator for the Office of the Provost-Undergraduate Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was first a phone interview, then an in-person. I did not get past the first in-person interview.  I spoke with 7 different people at the in-person interview.  They really wanted to see if I vibed with everyone I would have been working with.  I spoke with two/three employees at a time, split up into three different interview sessions around the office.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 10 years?
Why do you want to work here?

title: Assistant Director of Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen followed by on campus interview.  On campus lasted approximately 4 hours and included interviews with several different members of the college leadership.  Overall a positive experience and I got the job.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength

title: Broadcast Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston University in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Fake job they put the job on job board and after two days i got an email saying they found the right candidate. 
that is mean in two days only they found the right person without interviewing anyone else.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Affairs Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I worked in the grad affairs office when I was a student at BU and found out about this position through my former supervisor. I applied online, about two weeks later they contacted me to set up a phone interview, which was pretty informal since it was with two people who I had worked with previously. Then about two weeks later had an in person interview with the three people who would be on my core team. A week and a half or so later someone from Human Resources called me and asked me to come in. I went to the office that day and had another interview with him and then he offered me the position. A lot of steps in the process but worth it in the end.
Interview Questions: What ideas do you have to expand our applicant base?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview consists of several parts. First was a phone interview. The potential PI called me and briefly introduced herself to me. Second, it was a on-site interview. I gave a presentation and had a lunch with group members. In the afternoon, I had a talk with the program chairman, she asked me about my passion and interest, as well as introduction of the program and the format of training I would get in the next 2 years.
Interview Questions:
What do you want to do in the future?
What do  you think T32 will help you?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of two faculty and one staff member.  The questions were specific to the job requirements, asking about relevant experience.  There was an overview of what the program was about and the goals for development.  Since there were faculty, the focus was on the job itself, with no "standard" interview questions.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in international research contracts?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at the School of Public Health and the process was very thorough. In this particular department there was an interview with the manager, the manager's manager, other RAs working on the project, and the PI. Each one was a separate interview so there were 4 in total across 2 visits. It was a long process to say the least!
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions, definitely as they relate to research and the positions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Meet with PI, talked about experience and previous classes I had taken. They also check your transcript, which seems to be the biggest indicator as to weather or not you are hired.
Interview Questions: What's your GPA?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: There was not a formal process--I was internal coming from a temporary position and was recommended for the position, taken out to lunch, and asked a few informal questions as they already knew my work ethic.
Interview Questions: How do I think that I could contribute to the marketing efforts of (enter department name)?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Quincy, MA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a very nice phone interview.  It was very informative and I felt that my myself and my interviewer were able to learn a lot about each other including the kind of job I was looking for was well as kind of job responsibilities that the position that I was applying for would acquire.
Interview Questions: Why have you not had a paper published recently?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone screen with an RA who worked on the study they were hiring for. Then, I had a 30 minute in-person interview with the hiring manager.  This was followed by 1 hour in-person with various staff and managers who were all involved with the study.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: very few questions and they were very nice about it, I felt the interview process was very good to me because I was asked realistic questions. I would recommend trying and interviewing for them.
Interview Questions: How do you handle problems?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: applied online through BU's student link as I was a current student. the there was one phone call interview and two interviews in person. It was pretty straight forward and short process as I was already a student at Boston University.
Interview Questions: Do you have programming experience in R for Bioinformatics?

title: MarketingCGS Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: There's only one round of interview - Phone interview with CGS marketing director. She is very nice and supportive. She asked me about why I like marketing and what internships I did before.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume? Why marketing?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the primary investigator of the project I was working. We had 1 formal and 1 informal interview for the position. They discussed the details of the project and the position.
Interview Questions: What past experiences have prepared you for this position?

title: Department Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I responded to an ad and was contacted by Human Resources Dept.   After a brief screening with Human Resources I had a couple of rounds of interviews with the department chief as well as members of faculty and some staff members
Interview Questions: career goals

title: IS&T Questrom Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with IT head of Questrom Business School. He was very kind. I was a bit early, and business casual dressed. The latter did a good imression, the first i dont think so, he seemed like he didnt like that I was early. I was really anxious, and couldnt get a word out of me. It was my first interview
Interview Questions: Fit Questions, Actual knowledge of CSS and Web Development

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: The process is boring. I just applied online and write everything about me and it is over. I got accepted very soon and it was a pretty good experience. I fly to boston the following year. And I got a great start here.
Interview Questions: why apply to our university

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Was asked by the professor to be his TA, and I said yes! BU is a great place to TA! I would recommend all students to give it a shot- they won't regret it!
Interview Questions: Do you want to TA?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied via online portal and was contacted via email about 2 weeks later to arrange a conference call. Phone screen lasted 15 min. I was then invited for an in-person interview with a few staff members. Questions from phone screen were asked again in 2nd interview along with others.
Interview Questions: What interested you in this position? What would you expect from your manager in terms of leadership style? Strengths/weaknesses?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a thorough interview, 2 rounds - the people were thoughtful and nice and questions were not too difficult. The process went as smoothly as described. It took less than a month to receive an offer.
Interview Questions: Why admissions?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: They ask basic interview questions about my schooling and education. My interviewer was very nice and over all my interview went very well. I did not have to wait to long to hear back from them.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two professors vs. one candidate, including general talking about the responsibilities, skills review, project experience, and some analytical background. Also I made a short presentation on my project experience by unfolding some detailed background information of the project, and the timeline of the progress of the project I've done. Some programming skills were asked and tested.
Interview Questions: What kind of programming skills do you think may be beneficial to our project working

title: Study Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions, straight forward. They basically asked about my background, education and 5 year/ 10 year plan. They mostly talked to me about the lab, science and research and gave me a tour of the facilities. I met with the physician, nurse and manager. I also spoke with students in the lab while i waited in between interviews.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working in research?

title: Grants Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy interview process, telephone conference, 2 visits to campus for personal interviews.  After several follow up email exchanges I was made aware that someone with other work expertise not in granting assumed the position.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the table

title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very brief interview in the HR Office; friendly; no difficult questions. I immediately felt at ease with my interviewer and we clicked. It seems that they were looking for a young, approachable, well put together receptionist--and I fit the bill! My interviewer briefly looked over my resume and asked me to elaborate on some of my previous roles.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Program Assistant of the Dean of Students Office Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a Chief of Staff and Graduate Assistant. They asked basic behavioural questions, explained the role of the position and its' expectations, as well as fun questions about your interests and hobbies. The undergraduate staff is diverse in everything from extracurriculars, hobbies, and majors. The Dean's staff loves to chat and get to know individual students.
Interview Questions: Tell us about what you like to do for fun

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: First,  a phone call from HR, followed by a cam interview with the hiring department and then It was a scheduled day to go through several 1:1 interview with a group of people.
Interview Questions: What were your previous experiences?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal. I interviewed with my direct manager on a Tuesday, met the program director for a brief discussion (not position based) and was offered a job by that Friday.
Interview Questions: How previous experience would fit into job duties

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very comprehensive. There were 2 group interviews, each lasting 2 hours. During that time, you and the other interviewees were expected to work together to solve issues. Then, after the group interviews, each person had an individual interview. It was intense, but overall a good experience. Remember to not compete with the other interviewees--they are judging to see how you work in a team setting.
Interview Questions: Tell me why you would want the position

title: Stage and Entertainment Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, lasted about 30 minutes. The website was very helpful in keeping apprised as to the status of my application. I had always wanted to interview with them, and I felt lucky to have even made it to that phase. They gave me a choice of attending an in-person session in Florida or doing a phone interview. As I only had 2 days notice, I went with the phone option.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Disney

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Excellent Recruiters. Interview was set up with 30 minutes to an hour meeting with students and faculty. All travel expense was paid for including purposely leaving time for sight seeing.
Interview Questions: What are your career objectives

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an Interview at HR, which was very easy, the woman asked some basic questions and gave me some information about benefits. However, I had not been previously informed that after that interview I would immediately have to go to an interview with the department manager for the position I applied for (they had set up the interview saying it was an interview with HR). I had worked at BU as a student and already knew the manager so it wasn't too bad for me, but talking to others who were hired after me, I think it was a little more disconcerting for them. The hiring process after the interview went pretty quickly.
Interview Questions: They were all pretty typical behavioral type questions. I already knew the manager from previously working at BU so we got a bit off topic with things and it turned into more of just a chat than an interview

title: Payroll Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was quick with HR. The interview process with the actual team I worked with was a multi-step process and required multiple trips back to the University. The interviews were a combination of 1:1 with HR, and group interviews with the business teams. Overall the interview was quite standard and routine.
Interview Questions: Hands on experience with the systems - SAP, etc.

title: QA Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions:
I have applied through the university job listing. After that i got a call from them and they scheduled my interview. 

It was very good.. I was already prepared for all the questions hence I didnt face any issue.
Interview Questions: prepared

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied via the online portal from BU site, followed by in person interview where they discussed my core competencies to decide which ongoing research project that I might be a good fit for based on my profile and skills
Interview Questions: How you would be a good fit?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Application was made through the internet web site, and the submitted documents were reviewed by a committee. No any other type of interview process, But requiring a  84 Toefl exam and GRE exam and also above 3.0 GPA
Interview Questions: Background information

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online at career website for the company, received a call within a couple of weeks and completed phone interview, then was asked to come in within the same week. Interviewed with supervisor of the position, then came back for a second interview with the supervisor's boss. First interview was very good, second interview the interviewer did not ask many questions, talked a lot about himself.
Interview Questions: Interviewer spending a lot of time talking and not enough asking questions. It was hard to talk about myself or highlight my attributes when he just kept talking about himself.

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The Interview took about 15 minutes, in a closed room, one on one. He asked about past work experiences, and some small questions to get a feel for my personality. He then gave a few hypothetical work scenarios and asked how I would respond/deal with each one.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a client came and asked for help on some software you had never even heard of before?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews.  First was with HR and one hiring manager with basic job interview questions.  Second interview was with three senior staff and had more behavioral and industry specific questions.
Interview Questions: What are the three biggest challenges in higher education today?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a 30 minute phone interview, followed by a 45 min in person interview with the supervisor and another staff member. The final round interview was between myself, my supervisor and faculty whom I would be directly supporting, it was about an hour long. Once the position was offered to me, I had to do a final interview with HR - this is standard at BU, but catches you a little off guard since you've been offered the job by the people you'll be working with. The interview with HR asked me to describe my qualifications for the position, my salary requirements and gave me an opportunity to ask questions about benefits.
Interview Questions: Most interview questions were fairly generic. Faculty asked me what my greatest challenge in my previous position was.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: I have always had positive interview experiences for student positions at Boston University.  The CSC office is no different.  The Director and Asst. Director as well as students in the interview make you feel welcome and like you are worth their time.  This immediately put me at ease and allowed me to focus on crafting my responses instead of my nerves.  Further, they find places to relate to you.
Interview Questions: They always try to put people at ease by asking them something like what song describes you or who would play you in a movie.  This isn't something I generally think about so I just said the first thing that popped into my head, which probably didn't make any sense.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I received an employee referral for this position at the ERC/CCD and interviewed over the phone during the summer. The phone interview was more of a screening, just getting to know my personality and how I work in a team environment. I previously worked at BU in two other departments so it wasn't as formal as other interviews might be.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous work experience in this position?

title: Web Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: A long process, meeting with managers, directors and HR. Though the process was slow, it's common in education and the interviews weren't too difficult. Showing your work in a practical format is critical to getting more interviews/noticed.
Interview Questions: A problem relating to your field you encountered, how did you solve it?

title: Senior Financial Aid Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: one interview with management. second with hr. very nice people. seems like a great culture to work in. asked relevant work experience questions. focus on award processing. the position seemed to have a great work/life balance. second interview with hr. this was negotiation of salary and find out more about benefits and agreement before offer can be made
Interview Questions: normal detailed interview questions.

title: Secrer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy.
Interview Questions: Parents often complain about additional charges- How would you address their concern?

title: Desktop Services Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were a lot of specific, to the point questions. The interviewer was clearly looking for certain skills, such as teamwork, and technical skills. I could tell that the interview was geared toward finding out if the applicant would fit in with the team first, and technical skills later.
Interview Questions: If you are new to a site, how do you familiarize yourself?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was asked to answer a few questions about social media, graphic design, and engaging students. I attached my resume and a link to my graphic design work. Almost immediately, I was asked to interview. I was in New York at the time, so the Skype interview was about 20 minutes long and it felt very relaxed and casual, just like having conversation.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to work in a group and describe a challenge you faced.

title: Research Analyst, Institutional Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews total for this position.  I met with several very nice people from the office, which demonstrated to me how nice of an environment the office seemed.  The only drawback to this process is how slow they are to get back to you, which is fairly common in higher ed, at least (not sure about other industries). Still waiting to hear back...
Interview Questions: Questions were normal or typical- nothing out of left field.

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a phone screen, then on site interviews. I had six separate interviews on a single day. There was a schedule provided beforehand so I had an idea of who I was meeting with.
Interview Questions: What is your interpretation of the role and its responsibilities?

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had a one-to-one face interview on campus and it took around an hour to finish. Later I have been provided with a a tour in the lab. Overall experience was great and nothing very stressful or difficult
Interview Questions: Can you describe your past research experience?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions:
General PhD applications with most of the details on the department webpage. 
There are two streams: Post-Bachelor and Post-Master. PB is generally five years for ECE department, while PM is usually 4.
Online application requires personal statement of purpose, reference letters from previous professors, GRE General Test, (English exams if your first language is not English, and in some cases can be waived), Transcripts, and other supplementary materials.
It is also help to contact professors you are interested to work with.
Interview Questions: Personal Statement should address issues including research interests. It is not a detailed research proposal, but one has to demonstrate genuine research interest, possibly via showcasing past experiences in relevant fields (study, project or internship).

title: Doctoral Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Traditional graduate school application process
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: 3 round, 2 group and then one final one on one. they got us to play out a lot of situations to see how we would react to different event happening. then they interviewed individually on why we felt we should get the job
Interview Questions: what would you do if you found a student drinking

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Asked me about my interests and spend 2+ hours talking about his research. It was the most I would end up talking to the PI as now that I work there I almost never interact with him
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to join the lab

title: Neuroscience PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Application in the fall with a December deadline. Emails will go out for accepted interviews in January/February (a little later than most programs). Two day in-person interview with all other interviewees (about 40) at the end of interview season (late February or early March)
Interview Questions: What is your career goal?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boston University in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just met with PI to go through resume. Just reviewed the positions and job requirements. Overall, this was not a stressful process. I recommend this job to all students at BU. Be ready to discuss details on resume and previous experience. Also, will have to work on assigned projects. Many students work in the lab which is a benefit for younger students looking for mentors.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: No interview needed. Just talk with the professors here to see if they have open positions
Interview Questions: There is no difficult questions

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email to my professor and asked him if he could take me as a teaching assistant during the coming summer session. then he accepted.
Interview Questions: there is no really an interview process since he had known me very well throughout the semester

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty easy process of applying online and I was contacted by email to set up a 1:1 interview. The interview lasted about an hour and I was asked very typical interview questions about my background and interests. I heard from them by email within about a week with an offer of employment and I accepted.
Interview Questions: One thing they asked was why I wanted to work in that particular area of research.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: A 30 minutes chat with the professor. Talks about yourself, your strength and why would you like this job. Nothing technical. the professor would tell you about the responsibilities and his or her expectation.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted for a phone screen first, after 20-25 minutes I was invited in for an in-person interview. Interview was less than an hour. I did not get that position but I was encouraged to apply for another. I did as they said and re-submitted for the 2nd job, unfortunately that process took several more weeks so dont give up on this one too quickly!
Interview Questions: How would you handle an upset law student with a concern.

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews: one over the phone and two in person.
Interview Questions: The questions were not difficult, but the process was rather long.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: one interview- focussing on basic concepts of electrical engineering
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions, straight forward. They basically asked about my background, education and 5 year/ 10 year plan. They mostly talked to me about the lab, science and research and gave me a tour of the facilities. I met with the physician, nurse and manager. I also spoke with students in the lab while i waited in between interviews.
Interview Questions: Where have you travelled

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring staff was very friendly and exceedingly helpful in getting to know the job. It was overall a very positive experience with getting my feet wet in the university job process.
Interview Questions: Are you an experienced swimmer?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Talk with faculty of my Department.
Interview Questions: Based on what the professor needs.
