title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume in my department, department staff managed all the resumes for reviewing by professors. A professor picked mine because of the statistical background and emailed me for interview. Go to his office and answered some basic questions. Get hired after interview. nice experience.
Interview Questions: Asked me about whether I'm able to do statistical analysis

title: Proshop Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to the manager, very casual and friendly, about how I would add value to the proshop. We discussed my experience, academics and backgroud
Interview Questions: Weren't many questions one would expect in a traditional interview.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: Received a call back relatively quickly after submitting my application. Had an initial interview that lasted about 40 minutes, then was called back a week later to schedule a second interview that lasted about 30. Both interviews included direct supervisors and HR personnel; second interview included executive director.
Interview Questions: I thought the questions asked were ineffective interview questions. They were about very specific details - the kinds of things that, on the job, you'd be able to look up online or in another resource, like "What does this acronym stand for?" "Describe your knowledge of these set of regulations" rather than more functional questions designed to gauge my fit for the position.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: All day interview consisting of one on one meeting with faculty within the department, lunch and dinner with members of the search committee, and a teaching presentation. Followed up with an offer after a few weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe your teaching philosophy.

title: Study Abroad Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Quite a while after applying I got an invitation for an interview, basically I will tell you if you didn't stud at BU or study abroad with them its going to be rough trying to get a job through them, they hired an art student over my qualifications and experience.
Interview Questions: There were a bunch of hypothetical questions that cannot be answered in a vacuum and then some weird question about communication methods or something but fairly standad

title: General Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very informal. All behavioral. The questions were very basic, they just wanted to know your interests. Asked if you have previous experience with Excel, but it wasn't a big deal if you don't.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I basically applied for a PhD in systems engineering in Boston University and many other universities. The department of Systems Engineering at BU  was extremely fast, responsive and supportive. Two months later I was invited for an open house graduation. They booked my flight and hotel. I attended a three day graduate open house. It started with a dinner in a Japanese restaurant with a small group of friendly professors, the program director and other candidates. The day after we took a tour to see different labs and also we had 1:1 interviews with some potential advisers of our choice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to get PhD?

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Great! I had one in person interview- I believe they were trying to fill the position quickly. Very laid back but professional setting. I was very comfortable and everyone made me feel great!
Interview Questions: How will your past experience help you with this job?

title: Applications Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University
Interview Descriptions: The staff was extremely hospitable and enjoyable, always willing to help and lend a hand.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: FOH Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: super easy. was called  within 2 days of applying. student manager showed me all the necessary things and how to do what needs to be done. also introduced me to other important people working there.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Associate Director of Corporate Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: All development positions are posted on the BU development website, however through informational interviews I landed a direct interview with the hiring manager.  Throughout the process and through interaction with others, I believe the email correspondences from the interviewees are looked at as a vital part of the "interview."
Interview Questions: "why do you want THIS position"  well I couldn't answer convincingly enough it appeared.

title: Compliance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews were required and they were in depth and lengthy but enjoyable. When my boss interviewed me for the job we got to know each other and the values we shared, we appreciated each other from the start and that has endured.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your prior employer?

title: Financial Systems Director, BUworks Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Initial 1-hr interview with 4 people. Prior to interview I was given link to web site, but most access required a BU account. Softball questions; the interview started by their asking me if I had questions. Odd vibe in room as interviewers exchanged glances after each question I posed, as though they were afraid of revealing too much.

Second round of interviews were 3 hours with 10 people. No hard questions; purpose was to find "fit".
Interview Questions: How would I encourage resistant business offices who wanted to redesign the system yet were unable to translate their needs into technical requirements.

title: Undergraduate Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume, contacted for interview circa 5 weeks later. Met with HR person first, then returned a week later to meet with individual department, including department chair, direct supervisor, and the person departing the position.
Interview Questions: All questions were expected and basic.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston University (Phoneton, OH) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a phone call from a staff person checking on my CV, my goals, etc. Then I had to provide results of relevant tests and validate or demonstrate some of the achievements on my CV. I was also given the chance to visit and talk to some other researchers (but that not really a requirement)/
Interview Questions: Why did you pick us?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very informal and welcoming. The conversation was very light and never felt interragatory. I had previous experience with the office, though, so I was meeting with people I knew.
Interview Questions: What is your history with higher education?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: There were 6 different interviews, back to back. Each interview was 30 minutes long, and there were 8 prospective employees being interviewed. There was a series of questions that most of them asked, many being the typical interview questions. This got tiring and repetitive because nearly every interviewer asked the same questions.
Interview Questions: If you could erase one characteristic about yourself, what would it be?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boston University in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: There is the informational session and then two group interviews. You have to go to the informational session first before the two group interviews. They will ask you do tasks in teams and ask questions about scenarios in residence life.
Interview Questions: You have to work with other people in teams for interviews.

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: business system analyst - 3 rounds; the interview was both behavioral, and knowledge based- both of them were important- besides being competent in the analytic / technical side, personal treats were equally important (being a team player, probably the most important one); experience mattered as well (specific examples from previous work / jobs was helpful)
Interview Questions: both behavioral, and knowledge based; experience mattered as well

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively standard. Basic questions about what you envisioned to be your career path. What were your major strengths and your major weaknesses
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: High GPA and abilities of doing secondary data analysis, SPSS skills is favored.
Interview Questions: Based on what professor needs, the requirement will be differents

title: Business Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university careers website and heard back about a week later. There was an initial human resources phone screen where about 10 standard questions were asked about work style, experience, and overall work history. I then had an in-person interview with the hiring manger.
Interview Questions: One of the questions was related to finance and forecasting which I was unsure how to answer as that is not my specialty and I was unprepared at the time for it.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Relatively easy and low stress process. I got an email and interviewed in the same week. I was offered the position on the stop and actually began working the same day. Given, this was a student position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your greatest strength?

title: Teaching Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: get recommended, and then get interviewed. I was recommended by the head of my department and then get the interview notice to see the head of the math department. He saw my resume and asked me if I have teaching experience, and I said I only taught kids violin before
Interview Questions: How would you like to handle the student who is not satisfied with his score

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Quick and behavior-focused; helps to know someone within the University who can refer you and provide guidance. Multiple applications for different jobs gets you noticed (as long as you're qualified for each job).
Interview Questions:
How would you handle "x" behavioral problem/classroom management problem?
Why is now a good time for you to take on this challenge?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Pretty lenient; I was screened for the position from a group of current employees, and so my performance was known.  The group consisted of students who were active part time employees, who qualified for financial aid, and who had performed well at their current positions.  To my knowledge there wasn't any hiring across offices, but if you were identified as a member of this group, you could be considered for higher positions within your current university office.  Most of the questions were regarding schedule.
Interview Questions: Whether I might still be willing to work the overnight shifts from my previous position.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Invited for typical 2-day visit with job talk. Met with individual and small groups within department and college including several administrators. People were a bit snobbish bragging about what a wonderful school it is and how high the standards are to the point of being a bit hostile. Focus was clearly on how much money I could bring in research dollars.
Interview Questions: Typical 5 year plan, plan for funding, teaching experience.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted all application materials online following the instruction of the department.
After I got the offer from the graduate school, I contacted with the department and meet with my advisor.
Interview Questions: educational background, programming skills

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed 1:1 on the phone screen with the hiring manager.  In addition, did a phone screen with what would have been two peers and a direct report.  Also did two panel interviews three higher ups to which the hiring manager was late.  Did another panel interview with the same people that would have been peers and a direct report.  Overall, the questions were easy.  The information sharing was exceptional.  Discussed position and salary with the HR member.  However, they never got back to me after four interviews.  The position had been open five months before my round of interviews occured.  Perhaps they do not know exactly what they are looking for?  For that much time and energy invested - a negative response versus no response would have been appreciated.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you would integrate a new system when you will receive resistance from the current group of developers?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was a graduate student at BU and I just talked with one of the professors, so my case is not very general. The reviewer was rather nice, and mostly asked general questions.
Interview Questions: general questions like name, GPA, etc

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted by department manager within 4-6 weeks.  Interviewed in person and was brought back for a second interview a couple weeks later.
Interview Questions: Honestly I don't think anything was too out of the ordinary

title: Wordpress Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The person interviewing me was not familiar with programming and I felt he wasn't able to properly gauge my answers. I heard back that they were interested and then never heard back again. I've been contacted by 3 different people since the interview who had no idea I had already been interviewed.

A simple yes or no would have been fine.
Interview Questions: What's something I've worked on in the past I am proud of and why?

title: Liberty Mutual Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: this just a phone interview.
Interview Questions: what is you favorite class?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was pretty simple. It usually takes departments a long time to get back to you, but once you do, they try to onboard pretty quickly. It really depends on the department you are interviewing with. You will only be interviewed by the home department not by an HR representative for BU.
Interview Questions: I really hate this question but it is always asked: What is your greatest weakness? I think it displays a lack of creativity but it's always used.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I remember that it took a long time from the time I applied to when I got an interview.  In fact, I had forgotten that I'd applied!  The questions were pretty normal, but the job was not very fancy so that's to be expected.
Interview Questions: I was not an experienced interviewer (straight out of college), so every question was hard.  Looking back, all the normal questions.  Technology, how do you stay organized, how do you handle stress, etc.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was typical, with an application and 2 interviews.  The process was not long.
Interview Questions: Very few unexpected questions.  I was asked to pick my questions from a list - which made me think I was being judged on the questions I picked and my answers.

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was searching for jobs on the university website. Found the job at the Office of Disability Services that required someone who could interact with customers. Sent in my resume, and recieved a call the following week to come in for an interview. Went in and had a one-on-one interview with the director. Following week I recieved the job.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a student who came that had a speach impediment that you were unable to respond to?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied for postdoctoral position by e-mail and soon get call from the professor. He talk with me about my career goals and proposed to come for interview. At interview I made presentation of my research accomplishments for the lab members, talk with lab members 1:1 and with professor.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in person on 3 different times each time asked to squeeze interview in before the Christmas break which I accomodated. They wanted to make a decision and have an offer out before the break.  I was told multiple times that I was the lead candidate.  Then no response
Interview Questions: Reviewed work experience

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied with the Residence Life office. There were two classroom sessions of about twelve people, and we completed some hypothetical RA tasks, along with some getting-to-know-you type things. Then they called in March and said I had the job.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a highly emotional resident?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was long, drawn out, and unorganized.  The amount of time it took to finally get hired was out of control.  And there was very little description of salary ahead of time.   That came later where there was little room for negotiation.  Interviews were awkward and the questions asked were not related to the job itself.
Interview Questions: Nothing really, all just normal boring questions unrelated to the job.

title: Administrative  Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I felt very comfortable with the three people who interviewed me. There was good communication on their behalf in terms of scheduling my interview. The interview itself, I felt was good. The questions ranged from professional, asking me of the typical "what do you think is your best assests?" to the personal -- How would your family describe you-- to the silly and fun (do you like football?) 

It was only afterwards that they did not contact me, even though they said they would.
Interview Questions: "How would your parents describe you?"

title: Director of Finance Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: overview of the company
Interview Questions: How would you go about reorganizing this group?

title: Organic Synthesis Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended by a professor I had worked with as an undergraduate and applied within three months of graduation. The interview was scheduled via phone and involved a brief hour panel interview with the director and subsequently with the employees of the center. I presented my previous research work and we discussed my experiences. As it was in an academic setting, I knew before I accepted that I was required to work more than 40h/wk and on Saturdays. I wouldn't want to be in this job for long term but it was a good resume builder for graduate school later on.
Interview Questions: Do you see yourself pursuing this career in 5 years time?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: You fill out a form in the math and statistics department and they consider your grades as a means to hiring you
Interview Questions: List all math courses and grades

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2007
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers looks very friendly
Interview Questions: What will you do if you are given a pressure situation?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2007
Interview Descriptions: Easy, simple. Few behavioral questions, hard to get follow-up afterward. No experience necessary for the job, pay subsidized by state preferred.
Interview Questions: N/A
